main event: A large fireball with a long fiery tail was observed in Oahu, Hawaii on 17 June 1953.
interesting points: The fireball had a yellow tint and was much larger than a star., It was observed for about 2 to 3 seconds., The object was at an elevation of 45 degrees., The sighting was made from the Naval Supply Depot Oahu., The observer and two others reported the same sighting.
sighted object: a large fireball with a long fiery tail
witness description: Major Arthur Parker, his wife, and another military officer
